summary: This document outlines the confidential plea negotiation terms for Jeffrey Epstein. It details the state charges he would plead guilty to, the agreed-upon sentence of at least two years in prison, and the conditions under which federal investigations would be closed. It is a key document showing the proposed resolution of the 2008 case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the plea negotiations, agreeing to plead guilty to state charges related to sexual abuse of minors and to specific sentencing terms.

events.title: Proposed Epstein Plea and Sentencing
events.description: The document outlines terms where Epstein would plead guilty to state charges (lewd and lascivious battery on a child, solicitation of minors for prostitution, and sexual activity with minors) and receive a joint recommendation for at least two years in prison without probation.

events.title: Closure of Federal Investigations
events.description: The terms specify that after Epstein enters his state court plea and is sentenced, the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office will close their investigations into him.

locations: Southern District of Florida (U.S. District Court)
keyFacts: Epstein was to plead guilty to three Florida state charges: lewd and lascivious battery on a child, solicitation of minors for prostitution, and sexual activity with minors aged 16+.
The plea deal included a binding joint recommendation for at least two years in prison with no probation, community control, or opportunity to withhold adjudication.
Epstein would waive all challenges to the charges and the right to appeal as part of the agreement.
Epstein agreed not to contest federal court jurisdiction or the victim status of minors identified in the federal investigation if they filed suit under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255.
The agreement stipulated that federal investigations by the FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office would be closed upon Epstein's state court plea and sentencing.
